improvements have been accepted by the village board, or before the private
improvements have been approved by the village board, shall deposit with the
village, in escrow, in cash or an irrevocable letter of credit, an amount equal
to five percent (5%) of the approved engineer's estimate as a guarantee against
any defect in the material or workmanship furnished in connection with such
improvement latent in character and not discernible at the time of the final
acceptance or approval of such improvement and to guarantee against any damage
to such improvements by reason of settling of the ground, base or foundation
thereof. Such deposit may be applied by the village for any amounts required by
the village to correct any such defects arising within any applicable guarantee
or warranty period. The balance of such deposit, if any, held at the end of
thirteen (13) months following final acceptance or approval of such
improvements shall be refunded or returned to the depositor or to the order of
the depositor.
   D.   Maintenance Bonds: A subdivider or developer, before the public
improvements have been accepted by the village board, or private common
improvements have been approved by the village board, shall provide to the
village a maintenance bond in the amount of ten percent (10%) of the approved
engineer's estimate for a period of two (2) years.
   E.   Expiration Of Securities, Etc.: Expiration of any securities, escrow
monies, guarantees, warranties, bonds or letters of credit, as defined in this
section shall not expire during the months of November, December, January,
February, March or April.
   F.   Land Development Permit: Construction, including earthwork and
underground and surface improvements cannot begin until the land development
permit has been issued. (2016 Code)
CHAPTER 13
ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT
SECTION:
14-13-1: Administrative Officials
14-13-2: Enforcement Of Provisions
14-13-3: Variations And Exceptions
14-13-4: Appeals
14-13-5: Amendments
14-13-6: Public Utilities Permits
14-13-1: ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICIALS:
The following offices of the government of the village are concerned with the
administration of this chapter:
   A.   The village board. The village board is vested with the following
responsibilities in regard to the engineering standards and specifications:
      1.   Variations: Approval or disapproval of all variations and exceptions
recommended by the village engineer.
      2.   Amendments: Amendment of the regulations of this title when found
necessary and desirable after review by the village engineer.
   B.   The village engineer.
      1.   Review Of Engineering: The village engineer shall review all
engineering plans and make determinations in the areas of design standards and
engineering specifications, as stipulated herein.
      2.   Inspection Of Work: The village engineer shall inspect all
improvements required by this title both during construction and after
completion to ensure compliance with this title and with good construction
practice.
      3.   Conflict Of Interest: The village engineer shall not be retained by
a subdivider or other interested party to perform engineering work in any
subdivision or development subject to the application of this title.
      4.   Variations: Approval or disapproval of all variations and exceptions
to this title except where herein otherwise noted.
      5.   Enforcement: Initiation of appropriate proceeding to enforce the
provisions of this title. (2016 Code)
14-13-2: ENFORCEMENT OF PROVISIONS:
   A.   The village engineer shall administer this title and bring any
violations or lack of compliance herewith to the attention of the village
administrator.
   B.   No final plat of subdivision shall be approved which does not comply
with all the provisions of this title. (2016 Code)
14-13-3: VARIATIONS AND EXCEPTIONS:
   A.   Hardships: Where the village engineer finds that extraordinary
hardships or particular difficulties regarding the physical development of land
may result from strict compliance with these regulations, he may recommend
variations or exceptions (except where herein otherwise noted) to the
regulations so that substantial justice may be done and the public interest
secured; provided, that such variation or exception shall not have the effect
of nullifying the intent and purpose of this title; and further, provided, the
village engineer shall not recommend variations or exceptions to the
regulations of this title unless he shall make findings based upon the evidence
presented thereto in each specific case that:
      1.   Public Welfare Protected: The granting of the variation will not be
detrimental to the public safety, health or welfare or injurious to other
property or improvements in the neighborhood in which the property is located;
      2.   Unique Conditions: The conditions upon which the request for a
variation is based are unique to the property for which the variation is sought
and are not applicable, generally, to other property; and
      3.   Particular Physical Conditions: Because of the particular physical
surroundings, shape or topographical conditions of the specific property
involved, a particular hardship to the owner would result, as distinguished
from a mere inconvenience, if the strict letter of the regulations were carried
out.
   B.   Conditions: In recommending variations and exceptions, the village
engineer may require such conditions as will, in good judgment, secure
substantially the objectives of the standards or requirements of this title.
   C.   Procedure: A petition for any such variance shall be submitted in
writing by the developer. The petition shall state fully the grounds for the
application and all the facts relied upon by the petitioner.
   D.   Approval By Village Administrator: All requests for variations and
exceptions greater than plus or minus ten percent (±10%) of the defined
standards and specifications and those explicitly stated by this title shall be
forwarded to the village board for approval as in subsection E of this section.
Variations and exceptions of less than plus or minus ten percent (±10%) of the
defined standards and specifications as may be recommended by the village
engineer shall be forwarded to the village administrator in writing
substantiating the recommended variations and/or exceptions. The village
administrator may approve such variations or exceptions from the requirements
of this title in specific cases which, in his/her opinion do not adversely
affect the intent and purpose of this title.
   E.   Approval By Village Board: Where required, such variations and
exceptions as may be recommended by the village engineer shall be forwarded to
the village board in writing substantiating the recommended variations and/or
exceptions. The village board may approve such variations or exceptions from
the requirements of this title in specific cases which, in its opinion, do not
adversely affect the intent and purpose of this title. (2016 Code)
14-13-4: APPEALS:
Any person or corporation may appeal, within sixty (60) days, to the village
board any final action taken by the village engineer. The village board shall
act as a board of appeals and shall hear and decide appeals from and review any
final order, requirements, decision or determination made by the village
engineer under this title. The concurring vote of the majority of trustees
present shall be necessary to reverse any final order of the village engineer
under this title. (2016 Code)
14-13-5: AMENDMENTS:
For the purpose of promoting the public health, safety and general welfare, the
village board may from time to time amend the regulations imposed by this
title. The village engineer may consider proposed amendments and make
recommendations thereon to the village board. (2016 Code)
14-13-6: PUBLIC UTILITIES PERMITS:
Public utilities shall obtain permits from the village engineer for the
installation of communications, electric power, gas or other utility services
before any installation work is started. (2016 Code)
CHAPTER 14
STANDARD DRAWINGS
SECTION:
14-14-1: Adoption Of Standard Drawings
14-14-1: ADOPTION OF STANDARD DRAWINGS:
There are hereby adopted by reference the following standard drawings and
standards contained therein as part of the engineering standards and
